event: Here is the extracted table of events and timestamps:
stenosis of the internal axis carotis
fistula between esophagus and tracheal membrane
examined by several chiefs and consultants
deemed too unstable for open surgery
referred to hospital on surgical intensive care unit
ventilated through tracheostoma with low ventilation forces
big fistula of the tracheal membrane
tracheal cannula ended shortly beneath lower limit of mediastinal fistula
plan to close fistula with pedicled omentum majus replacement
surgical plastic needed abutment and secured continuous airway replacement
vv-ECMO began to be partly ineffective
high volume input of physiological saline needed
oral approach only allowed small flexible bronchoscope
approach for upper part of trachea had to be performed through percutaneous tracheostoma
trying different Dumon and one-hybrid self expandable metalic y-stent
plan to changeover to more floppy Freitag stent (FS)
successful retrograde stenting performed in four steps
manually compressed “y” of FS pushed downward on main carina
frontal surface of stent cut with at least 1 cm opening in longitudinal axis
stent surface reduced ~40% in sagittal axis
new stoma for regular tracheal cannula created
lower new edge of stoma fixed subcutaneously
jagwire introduced through mouth into trachea
jagwire running out of new FS stoma
soft-tip stiff DLET introduced for more stability
DLET dragged out of new stoma of cut FS
distal jagwire introduced into oral orifice of FS
FS flipped with upper part over soft-tip stiff DLET into upper third of trachea
whole fistula bridged by FS up to level of vocal cords
upper edge of new FS stoma fixed subcutaneously
regular tracheal cannula introduced for ventilation
lungs not aerated at that point of time
patient could communicate with family by writing and eyes
infections continued to be very severe
spontaneous work of breathing never exceeded tidal ventilation of 170 mL per breath
reduction of intravenous saline injection limited
patient and family decided to actively reduce vv-ECMO support
